item.caption: KEVIN GERARD HART MD - 06/05/2013 12:12 PM PDT
item.paragraph:
Formatting of this note might be different from the original.
Clinical Progress Note:
Patient presents with a chief complaint of COUGH
HPI:
He complains of cough for 30-60 minutes after eating or exercising. Cough is not productive. It has been present for 4 weeks. No sore throat. No runny nose. History of childhood asthma. No wheezing. Doesn't wake or keep him up at night.
I have reviewed Manav's:
medical history with no changes 6/5/2013
Review of Systems:
Constitutional: negative for fever
Physical Examination:
BP 117/77 | Pulse 95 | Temp(Src) 97.6 F (36.4 C) (Temporal) | Ht 5' 6" | Wt 144 lb 12.8 oz (65.681 kg) | BMI 23.37 kg/m2 | SpO2 97%
General appearance - vital signs reviewed and alert, well appearing, and in no distress
Mental status - alert, oriented to person, place, and time, normal mood, behavior, speech, dress, motor activity, and thought processes
Eyes - pupils equal and reactive, extraocular eye movements intact
ENT - Ears bilateral TM's and external ear canals normal
ENT - Nose normal and patent, no erythema, discharge or polyps
ENT - Mouth mucous membranes moist, pharynx normal without lesions
Neck - supple, no significant cervical adenopathy
Lymphatics - no palpable lymphadenopathy
Respiratory - clear to auscultation, no wheezes, rales or rhonchi, symmetric air entry
Data Reviewed: Reviewed lab results:
WBC 9.3 11/30/2012
HCT 50.1 11/30/2012
HGB 16.8 11/30/2012
PLT 285 11/30/2012
CHOL 265 11/30/2012
HDL 49 11/30/2012
LDL CALC 187 11/30/2012
TRIG 143 11/30/2012
ALT 18 12/19/2012
AST 18 12/19/2012
BUN 19 02/16/2012
CREAT 0.93 11/30/2012
GFR-AFRAM >60 11/30/2012
GFR NONAFR AMER >60 11/30/2012
GFR-NONAFRAM >60 02/16/2012
K 4.5 02/16/2012
NA 139 02/16/2012
CO2 28 02/16/2012
CL 101 02/16/2012
TSH 1.59 03/12/2013
GLUC FAST 97 11/30/2012
GLUC 95 02/16/2012
HGBA1C % 5.3 02/16/2012
ESTIMATED AVERAGE GLUCOSE 105 02/16/2012
Assessment & Plan: CHRONIC SINUSITIS (primary encounter diagnosis)
Note: Ibuprofen for sore throat - 400 mg to 800 mg (2 to 4 tablets) three times daily. Not more than 12 tablets in 24 hours.
Afrin nasal spray for stuffed nose - DON'T USE FOR MORE THAN 3 DAYS TO PREVENT REBOUND EFFECT.
Sudafed for stuffed nose (30 mg three times daily) One half recommended dose. Don't take after 5 PM. It will cause insomnia.
Rest.
Drink lots of fluids.
Consider NeilMed Sinus Rinse
Plan: DOXYCYCLINE HYCLATE 100 MG ORAL CAP - Take 1 capsule orally 2 times a day until gone - Disp: 20, Refill: 0
PROAIR HFA 90 MCG/ACTUATION INHL HFAA - Use 2 puffs orally every 4 hours when needed for quick relief of asthma symptoms - Disp: 8.5, Refill: 0
AEROCHAMBER Z-STAT PLUS-FLW SG MISC SPCR - Use as directed with inhalers - Disp: 1, Refill: 0
Electronically signed by KEVIN GERARD HART MD at 06/07/2013 7:46 AM PDT
